Deficiency Narrative: It is documented on a child's face sheet that he does not have any allergies or other conditions, when has a known health condition and allergies.
Correction Narrative:
8/30/23: Per the Administrator, Hands of Healing will document all allergies and conditions on a childs face sheet, upon entering the program.  The childs Hands of Healing Case manager will make sure this information is correct and accurate upon the clients admission with the assigned DFPS worker to the program and will ask questions where needed.  
8/29/23: Operation provided a copy of the corrected information. Written corrections only restated the standard, returned for more details.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's Admissions Assessment and current Service Plan contains conflicting information regarding his allergies, health condition, and medications.
Correction Narrative:
8/30/23: Per the Administrator, Hands of Healing will maintain current, true, accurate, and complete records. The childs Hands of Healing Case manager will make sure this information is correct and accurate upon the clients admission with the assigned DFPS worker to the program and will ask questions where needed. 
8/29/23: Operation provided a copy of the corrected information. Written corrections only restated the standard, returned for more details.

Deficiency Narrative: An 8yo child was placed at the operation on 3/3/2023. However, the operation is licensed for ages 9-17 at the time of placement through present date.
Correction Narrative: Per Administrator Maria Laflam during HM PPM visit on 8/15/23, resident was discharged 8/8/23. Via email she stated "Hands of Healing will not admit children into the operation whose do not meet admission requirements or whose needs Hands or Healing can not assist/meet."

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report about a youth in care self-harming and being admitted to the hospital timely.
Correction Narrative: Per the Administrator, Hands of Healing has added a spot-on serious incident report, with the phone number to hotline along with phone number to contracts. The staff writing the serious incident will be responsible to call in with in 24 hours. Program Director and Assistant Program Director will check for compliance with in the 24 hour period.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report an injury to a child who received medical attention at an urgent care center for a sprained thumb. Medical documentation confirms the child was diagnosed with a sprained finger and was also taken for a follow-up evaluation with an orthopedic specialist.
Correction Narrative: Hands of Healing will report all serious incidents no less than 24 hours after injury/illness.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff directly involved in an incident was not documented on the serious incident report.
Correction Narrative: Per the Administrator, all staff involved in incidents will be documented in an incident report. Another staff signature spot was added to the incident report for extra staff involved to sign. And staff were retrained on documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was neglectfully supervised by two Direct Care Staff resulting in the child being able to self-harm.
Correction Narrative: Hands of Healing had a refresher training course with staff, regarding child rights. Staff are being monitored by Shift Lead, Program Director, and Administrator for their compliance to child rights. Hands of Healing also participated in a Trauma Informed Training with Dr. Holly to talk about Trauma which develops from abuse, neglect, exploitation, and how it relates to the boys along with their behavior.

Deficiency Narrative: A Direct Care Staff did not demonstrate prudent judgement when recording a child displaying self-injurious behaviors for proof that the child injured himself and the staff did not.
Correction Narrative:
Hands of Healing staff will maintain responsibility for the health, safety, and well-being of children at all times. Hands of Healing has been trained to maintain the rights of all children admitted into the Hands of Healing program. Hands of Healing staff will protect the rights of all children in care, staff will safeguard the health of all children, assure the children of appropriate and necessary equipment, supplies, and facilities to meet their personal, recreational, and educational needs. 
5/31/23: Training and all staff meetings sign-in sheets were provided by the operation at PPM visit on 5/31/23. Per BGC for staff directly involved in the incident were inactive as of 4/28/23.

Deficiency Narrative: Two Direct Care Staff did not intervene while a child was self-harming, due to the child bleeding.
Correction Narrative:
The two staff that did not intervene while the child was self-harming have been terminated. 
Hands of Healing staff were educated on their daily responsibilities. They were informed that their job is to ensure the safety of all children living at Hands of Healing. 
Hands of Healing Staff were retrained on EBI especially as it relates to self-harm. Hands of Healing staff were refreshed on the protocol of assisting with a child who is bleeding and intervening immediately. Hands of Healing staff will continue to be refreshed on this information, they were informed of the importance of a restraint in this situation. It can reduce the self-harm behavior.  

Hands of Healing has done training to remedy this situation in order to keep it an isolated incident. Hands of Healing will continue to provide training with staff in areas where Hands of Healing notices staff may need further training. 
5/31/23: Training and all staff meetings sign-in sheets were provided by the operation at PPM visit on 5/31/23. Per BGC for staff involved in the incident were inactive as of 4/28/23.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff did not consider the risk of harm to a child when deciding not to restrain the child.
Correction Narrative:
EBI/Crisis Prevention Intervention training has been done with Hands of Healing staff. 
Hands of Healing Staff were retrained on Emergency Behavior Interventions especially as it relates to self-harm. Hands of Healing staff were refreshed on the protocol of assisting with a child who is bleeding and intervening immediately. Hands of Healing staff will continue to be refreshed on this information, they were informed of the importance of a restraint in this situation. It can reduce self-harm behavior.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care expressed that a staff told them what an investigation was in reference to, prior to being interviewed.
Correction Narrative: Per the Administrator, Hands of Healing Staff will not interfere with an investigation. Hands of Healing staff will not discuss investigations or inform the children of investigations.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility there were several doors  to office and hallway closets unlocked where scisors and cleaning chemicals are found. There was also an outside generator unlocked for a child to be able to access the inside componets and can cause harm.
Correction Narrative: Hands of Healing will lock all chemicals and doors as required. Generator will be always locked. All will be checked during facility walk through, daily.

Deficiency Narrative: upon review of background checks it was seen the operation has not validated their background checks since 6-27-22.
Correction Narrative: Hands of Healing will validate current background list every three month. Hands of Healing will place this with training items, so it will show red, when it is due. And it will be strategically kept up with.

Deficiency Narrative: The triggered reviews documented do not have the required components outlined in 748.461(1)-(4).
Correction Narrative: The agency created a triggered review meeting report that discusses AWOL occurrences, Safety Plans, AWOL debriefings, and incorporates trauma informed strategies.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member's choice of words used while redirecting a child in care were found to be inappropriate.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the operations.
Correction for the citation. It is the responsibility of Hands of Healing to ensure the safety of each youth in care. Each staff is expected to demonstrate self-control in the presences of youth in care.  Each staff has been trained in Non-Violent Crisis Interventions and Verbal Crisis Interventions. The staff that was subject of this investigation received Verbal Crisis Intervention and Verbal De-Escalating Techniques Training during Pre-Service on 5/19/2021, and again on 5/9/2022. If any staff is found to be not exercising prudent judgment when dealing with youth in care will be reprimanded. This will be monitored by the staff supervisor and the Program Administrator.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple Serious & Non-Serious Incident Reports requested were not documented properly. At least 9 of the 18 reports, were missing the nature of the incidents, circumstances surrounding the incidents, EBI documentation (if a restraint took place), incident location, interventions made during and after the incidents, witness details, licensed health-care professional treating the child involved, resolution of the incidents, and several lack details of preventative measures (preventative measures do not reflect service plan requirements).At least one incident report is not documented.
Correction Narrative:
An email was sent to rccr staff stating It is Hands of Healings duty to ensure that all documentation is completed in its entirety. Hands of Healing will ensure that each document will follow the listed procedures below. 
1.	Youth care worker will complete document in its entirety. 
2.	Shift leader will review all incident prior to submission to the administrator. 
3.	If the document is incomplete. Shift leader will return the document to the youth care worker for correction and completion. 
4.	Once the document is corrected it will be returned to the shift leader. 
5.	Once the shift leader reviews the document it will be submitted to the program administrator. 
6.	The program administrator will review the document for compliance. Once the administrator feels that the documents is in compliance it will be placed in the childs file.

Deficiency Narrative: Service Plans requested shows 24-hour continuous awake supervision while at the facility, constant supervision at the facility and during recreational activities, or supervision by sight and hearing while at the facility and during recreational activities which is not provided to the children it is specified for.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff stating The treatment director will meet with staff as it relates to the safety plan and supervisions strategies for each child. The treatment director will assure that during staff meetings and weekly treatment team meetings that shift leaders and youth care workers are reminded of the supervision strategies for each resident.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 out of the 3 service plans requested and reviewed have calming techniques and copping mechanisms that are not being implemented.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr staff from the operation staff stating The treatment director will review service plans upon its completion and will meet with youth to determine if the calming techniques and coping mechanisms are being implemented by the staff. This will be done on a weekly basis and if it determined that he staff is not implementing them, the treatment director will meet with the staff to teach, train and remind them of the procedures that need to take place.

Deficiency Narrative:
It was reported that the administrator and a staff questioned the victim and the alleged staff prior to making the report. 
It was reported that the administrator coached the staff and children on what to say or not say if questioned by stating, "if staff was not present during the incident and did not see what had happened they should not say anything unless they did see the incident."
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to RCCR staff with the corrective action stating the administrator was re-trained and staff was retrained related to incident reporting and administrator tasks.The director sent a detailed email to rccr staff regarding the citations and the reason for the administrative review and stated in the email We respectfully request that our correction plan be delayed pending the outcome of this Administrative Review, since we are challenging the findings.

Deficiency Narrative:
Operation policy states that one staff member is a driver and one sits in the back in the center of van to monitor the children.
It was reported that while children were being transported both staff were seating in the front of the van it was reported one staff was driving and the other staff was in the passenger seat.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was sent to rccr staff stating their was a staff meeting going over the transportation policies. An additional statement stated the staff will ride in the back of the van as required.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation it was reported that the vehicle used to transport the children did not have a first aid kit inside the vehicle.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was sent to rccr staff stating their was a staff meeting going over the transportation policies including first aid kit being present in each vehicle. An additional statement stated their was first aid kits placed in each van and their is a system in place to ensure that before the van is in motion their will be a first aid kit in the vehicle.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was restrained over the 4 times within a 7 day period without having a triggered review conducted.
Correction Narrative: A trigger review was conducted with the child. A list of topics addressed and attendees was sent to rccr staff via email regarding the trigger review. A corrective action email was sent regarding stating moving forward triggered reviews will be conducted timely if needed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan  review did not have the date of participation listed for the psychiatrist.

Deficiency Narrative:
It was reported  that night staff did  activities that impeded on their ability to supervise residents while on shift by  either falling asleep or playing on their phones.  
It was reported that children engaged in inappropriate sexual acts with one another during these times.
Correction Narrative:
